query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «Vexilla regis prodeunt inferni 2 verso di noi; però dinanzi mira», 3 disse ’l maestro mio, «se tu ’l discerni».
query.error: **English:** 1 The banners of the king of hell advance 2 towards us; therefore look ahead,” 3 said my master, “if you can make them out.”
query.result: 1 Banerow an myghtern an ifern a dheuth 2 dhe'n agan kyns; rag henna mira,” 3 a leveris ow mester, “ma ty a'n gwels.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Come quando una grossa nebbia spira, 5 o quando l’emisperio nostro annotta, 6 par di lungi un molin che ’l vento gira,
query.error: **English:** 4 As when a thick fog blows, 5 or when our hemisphere darkens at night, 6 from afar a mill seems to be turning in the wind,
query.result: 4 Kepar ha pan voos tewl spyr, 5 po pan voos an emysfer a'gan nottya, 6 a weler a bell molin a drohia gans an gwyns,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 veder mi parve un tal dificio allotta; 8 poi per lo vento mi ristrinsi retro 9 al duca mio, ché non lì era altra grotta.
query.error: **English:** 7 I seemed to see such a structure then; 8 then because of the wind I drew back behind 9 my guide, for there was no other shelter there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Già era, e con paura il metto in metro, 11 là dove l’ombre tutte eran coperte, 12 e trasparien come festuca in vetro.
query.error: **English:** 10 It was already, and with fear I put it into verse, 11 there where all the shadows were covered, 12 and shone through like a straw in glass.
query.result: 10 Hi o, ha gans ow a'n gosowgh yn mesur, 11 ena le mayth ool an scouth o cobber, 12 ha'gas splanya kepar festug yn wydr.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Altre sono a giacere; altre stanno erte, 14 quella col capo e quella con le piante; 15 altra, com’ arco, il volto a’ piè rinverte.
query.error: **English:** 13 Others lie prone; others stand upright, 14 one with its head and one with its feet; 15 another, like a bow, bends its face to its feet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Quando noi fummo fatti tanto avante, 17 ch’al mio maestro piacque di mostrarmi 18 la creatura ch’ebbe il bel sembiante,
query.error: **English:** 16 When we had advanced so far, 17 that it pleased my master to show me 18 the creature that had the beautiful form,
query.result: 16 Pan vyn ni ow tos owthyn kemmys, 17 mayth dhe'n ow mester ow karas dhe'm diskwedhes 18 an kreadur a vea an semlant brav,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 d’innanzi mi si tolse e fé restarmi, 20 «Ecco Dite», dicendo, «ed ecco il loco 21 ove convien che di fortezza t’armi».
query.error: **English:** 19 he moved in front of me and made me stop, 20 saying, “Behold Dis, and behold the place 21 where you must arm yourself with fortitude.”
query.result: 19 ow tos ow kensa ha'gas owthyn ow sevel, 20 ow leverel, “Sel Dite”, ow leverel, “ha henna an le”, 21 le mayth yma y fydh reydh dhe'th armya gans nerth”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Com’ io divenni allor gelato e fioco, 23 nol dimandar, lettor, ch’i’ non lo scrivo, 24 però ch’ogne parlar sarebbe poco.
query.error: **English:** 22 How I became frozen and faint then, 23 do not ask me, reader, for I will not write it, 24 because any words would be inadequate.
query.result: 22 Kepar ha my a dheuth yen skollys ha gwann, 23 na'th gorra, lenor, rag nyns y skrifav, 24 rag mayth pub traeth a vydh byghan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Io non mori’ e non rimasi vivo; 26 pensa oggimai per te, s’hai fior d’ingegno, 27 qual io divenni, d’uno e d’altro privo.
query.error: **English:** 25 I did not die, and I did not remain alive; 26 now think for yourself, if you have a spark of intelligence, 27 what I became, deprived of both one and the other.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Lo ’mperador del doloroso regno 29 da mezzo ’l petto uscia fuor de la ghiaccia; 30 e più con un gigante io mi convegno,
query.error: **English:** 28 The emperor of the sorrowful kingdom 29 emerged from the ice up to the middle of his chest; 30 and I have more in common with a giant,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 che i giganti non fan con le sue braccia: 32 vedi oggimai quant’ esser dee quel tutto 33 ch’a così fatta parte si confaccia.
query.error: **English:** 31 than the giants have with his arms: 32 now consider how large that whole must be 33 that is proportionate to such a part.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 S’el fu sì bel com’ elli è ora brutto, 35 e contra ’l suo fattore alzò le ciglia, 36 ben dee da lui procedere ogne lutto.
query.error: **English:** 34 If he was as beautiful as he is now ugly, 35 and raised his eyebrows against his creator, 36 then all sorrow must indeed proceed from him.
query.result: 34 Ma'th o byth kemmys brav ages o bella, 35 ha'gas ow sevel y'n fenester dhe'n y Grewr, 36 ow wra pub trues ow tos a-dhyworth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Oh quanto parve a me gran maraviglia 38 quand’ io vidi tre facce a la sua testa! 39 L’una dinanzi, e quella era vermiglia;
query.error: **English:** 37 Oh, how great a marvel it seemed to me 38 when I saw three faces on his head! 39 One was in front, and that was crimson;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 l’altr’ eran due, che s’aggiugnieno a questa 41 sovresso ’l mezzo di ciascuna spalla, 42 e sé giugnieno al loco de la cresta:
query.error: **English:** 40 the other two were joined to this one 41 above the middle of each shoulder, 42 and they met at the place of the crown:
query.result: 40 an dhew o byth, ow tos ow junya dhe'n henna 41 ow tos ow'n kres a pub skwydh, 42 ha'gas ow junya dhe'n le an kres:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 e la destra parea tra bianca e gialla; 44 la sinistra a vedere era tal, quali 45 vegnon di là onde ’l Nilo s’avvalla.
query.error: **English:** 43 and the right one seemed to be between white and yellow; 44 the left one, to look at, was like those 45 who come from where the Nile descends.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Sotto ciascuna uscivan due grand’ ali, 47 quanto si convenia a tanto uccello: 48 vele di mar non vid’ io mai cotali.
query.error: **English:** 46 Beneath each one emerged two mighty wings, 47 as befitting such a bird: 48 I never saw such sails upon the sea.
query.result: 46 Danvena pub onan dew bleujennow meur, 47 kepar hag oedh dhe'n evn dhegel, 48 hwyliow mor nans yw kensa vythkweth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Non avean penne, ma di vispistrello 50 era lor modo; e quelle svolazzava, 51 sì che tre venti si movean da ello:
query.error: **English:** 49 They had no feathers, but were like bats, 50 and they flapped their wings, 51 so that three winds blew from them:
query.result: 49 Nag oedh pluv dhe'n ev, mes kepar ednow, 50 oedh aga fordh; hagan hwyli, 51 wosa teyr gwavas a dheuth dhyworth ev:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 quindi Cocito tutto s’aggelava. 53 Con sei occhi piangëa, e per tre menti 54 gocciava ’l pianto e sanguinosa bava.
query.error: **English:** 52 and Cocytus was frozen all over. 53 With six eyes he wept, and over three chins 54 tears and bloody foam dripped down.
query.result: 52 hagan oedh Cocytus oll a-yeyn. 53 Gansoghlagas ev a-wela, ha dres menton 54 oedh an dowrans an gwelyow ha gweres.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Da ogne bocca dirompea co’ denti 56 un peccatore, a guisa di maciulla, 57 sì che tre ne facea così dolenti.
query.error: **English:** 55 In each mouth he crushed a sinner with his teeth, 56 like a dog worries a hide, 57 so that he made three of them suffer thus.
query.result: 55 Yn pub geno ev a-grynya gansogh 56 pechyor, kepar kolvan a-grynya kroc, 57 wosa teyr tri oedh a-dhybrya kepar na.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 A quel dinanzi il mordere era nulla 59 verso ’l graffiar, che talvolta la schiena 60 rimanea de la pelle tutta brulla.
query.error: **English:** 58 Compared to the clawing, the biting in front 59 was nothing, for sometimes the back 60 was completely stripped of skin.
query.result: 58 Yn kyns na, an mordhya oedh nans yw, 59 orth an krabya, rag a-veyth an golon 60 a-hedhy briw dhe'n kroc oll a-dhybrya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 «Quell’ anima là sù c’ha maggior pena», 62 disse ’l maestro, «è Giuda Scarïotto, 63 che ’l capo ha dentro e fuor le gambe mena.
query.error: **English:** 61 "That soul up there who suffers the greatest pain," 62 said the master, "is Judas Iscariot, 63 whose head is inside and whose legs stick out.
query.result: 61 "An eneval ena uhella a-dhybrya moyha," 62 a leveris an mester, "yu Judas Scarïotto, 63 hag y ben a-ves ha'y eskern a-dhybrya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 De li altri due c’hanno il capo di sotto, 65 quel che pende dal nero ceffo è Bruto: 66 vedi come si storce, e non fa motto!;
query.error: **English:** 64 Of the other two who have their heads down, 65 the one who hangs by the black snout is Brutus: 66 see how he writhes, and does not speak!;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 e l’altro è Cassio, che par sì membruto. 68 Ma la notte risurge, e oramai 69 è da partir, ché tutto avem veduto».
query.error: **English:** 67 and the other is Cassius, who seems so strong. 68 But night is rising, and now 69 it is time to leave, for we have seen everything."
query.result: 67 hag an arall yu Cassio, hag a-hedh kepar moyha. 68 Mes an nos a wra dhevedh, ha lemmyn 69 yw an prys dhe dhyskwedhes, rag ni a welas pub tra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Com’ a lui piacque, il collo li avvinghiai; 71 ed el prese di tempo e loco poste, 72 e quando l’ali fuoro aperte assai,
query.error: **English:** 70 As he wished, I put my arms around his neck; 71 and he chose the right time and place, 72 and when his wings were spread wide,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 appigliò sé a le vellute coste; 74 di vello in vello giù discese poscia 75 tra ’l folto pelo e le gelate croste.
query.error: **English:** 73 he clung to his hairy sides; 74 he then descended from hair to hair 75 between the thick fur and the icy crusts.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Quando noi fummo là dove la coscia 77 si volge, a punto in sul grosso de l’anche, 78 lo duca, con fatica e con angoscia,
query.error: **English:** 76 When we were there where the thigh 77 turns, right at the thickest part of the haunch, 78 the leader, with effort and distress,
query.result: 76 Pan o veuyn ni le may le may 77 a dro dhe'n poynt war an hanch moyha, 78 an dywgh, gans boes ha gans angos,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 volse la testa ov’ elli avea le zanche, 80 e aggrappossi al pel com’ om che sale, 81 sì che ’n inferno i’ credea tornar anche.
query.error: **English:** 79 turned his head where he had his legs, 80 and gripped the hair like a man who climbs, 81 so that I thought I was returning to hell again.
query.result: 79 a dro'y ben ow le may y eskern, 80 ha'y a dheuth dhe'y flew dell yw den a dhrehedh, 81 byttegys y'm cresen ef a wra dyworth dhe'n ifern arta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 «Attienti ben, ché per cotali scale», 83 disse ’l maestro, ansando com’ uom lasso, 84 «conviensi dipartir da tanto male».
query.error: **English:** 82 "Pay close attention, for by such stairs," 83 said the master, panting like a weary man, 84 "one must depart from so much evil."
query.result: 82 "Bew orth, rag gans an seur scaleow ma", 83 a leveris an mester, ow pansya dell yw den dallethys, 84 "yma yw rydh dhe dhyskwedhes a gemmys kalet ma".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Poi uscì fuor per lo fóro d’un sasso 86 e puose me in su l’orlo a sedere; 87 appresso porse a me l’accorto passo.
query.error: **English:** 85 Then he went out through the opening of a rock 86 and made me sit down on the edge; 87 then he carefully placed his step next to mine.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Io levai li occhi e credetti vedere 89 Lucifero com’ io l’avea lasciato, 90 e vidili le gambe in sù tenere;
query.error: **English:** 88 I lifted my eyes and thought I saw 89 Lucifer as I had left him, 90 and I saw him holding his legs up;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 e s’io divenni allora travagliato, 92 la gente grossa il pensi, che non vede 93 qual è quel punto ch’io avea passato.
query.error: **English:** 91 and if I became distressed then, 92 let the common people think about it, who do not see 93 what point it was that I had passed.
query.result: 91 ha'gas vyth vythow trevalyes vythens, 92 an bobel vyth a wra vyth poesow, neb a wel 93 pyth poynt o vythow tremenys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 «Lèvati sù», disse ’l maestro, «in piede: 95 la via è lunga e ’l cammino è malvagio, 96 e già il sole a mezza terza riede».
query.error: **English:** 94 “Get up,” said the master, “on your feet: 95 the way is long and the path is evil, 96 and already the sun returns to mid-morning.”
query.result: 94 “Codh sevel,” a lever an mester, “warbarth: 95 hir yw an fordh ha drog yw an hyns, 96 ha nownyth yw’n howl ow tosow dhe gres-dhegves.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Non era camminata di palagio 98 là ’v’ eravam, ma natural burella 99 ch’avea mal suolo e di lume disagio.
query.error: **English:** 97 It was not a palace walk 98 where we were, but a natural ravine 99 that had bad ground and lack of light.
query.result: 97 Nyns o fordh a balas 98 le may ajon, mes eneval naturel 99 owth o dowr drog ha difeyth a wydhlow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 «Prima ch’io de l’abisso mi divella, 101 maestro mio», diss’ io quando fui dritto, 102 «a trarmi d’erro un poco mi favella:
query.error: **English:** 100 “Before I pull myself out of the abyss, 101 my master,” I said when I was upright, 102 “speak to me a little to free me from error:
query.result: 100 “Myns vyth tynnergh a’n dibyn, 101 vy mester,” me a lever pan o vythsa dha vos, 102 “levergh vy dhyn vy dhe worra dhyworth kamm:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 ov’ è la ghiaccia? e questi com’ è fitto 104 sì sottosopra? e come, in sì poc’ ora, 105 da sera a mane ha fatto il sol tragitto?».
query.error: **English:** 103 where is the ice? and how is this one fixed 104 upside down? and how, in such a short time, 105 has the sun made the journey from evening to morning?”
query.result: 103 le may an jea? ha pyth yw hemma festys 104 marow bys y’n fordh? ha pyth, y’n termyn byghan mar, 105 a-dhia dhe vogh dhe voghthor an howl ow tremenys?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Ed elli a me: «Tu imagini ancora 107 d’esser di là dal centro, ov’ io mi presi 108 al pel del vermo reo che ’l mondo fóra.
query.error: **English:** 106 And he to me: “You still imagine 107 that you are on the other side of the center, where I seized 108 the hair of the wicked worm that pierces the world.
query.result: 106 Ha ef dhyn vy: “Ty a wra vyth poes 107 dhe vos dhe’n fordh a’n kres, le may y’m kemeras 108 dhe vledhen a’n pryv kamm owth a fora an bys.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Di là fosti cotanto quant’ io scesi; 110 quand’ io mi volsi, tu passasti ’l punto 111 al qual si traggon d’ogne parte i pesi.
query.error: **English:** 109 You were on that side as much as I descended; 110 when I turned, you passed the point 111 to which all weights are drawn from every side.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 E se’ or sotto l’emisperio giunto 113 ch’è contraposto a quel che la gran secca 114 coverchia, e sotto ’l cui colmo consunto
query.error: **English:** 112 And if you have now reached beneath the hemisphere 113 that is opposite to the one that the great dry land 114 covers, and beneath whose summit wasted away
query.result: 112 Ha marow osow a-dhia an emysfer 113 owth yw gwrys dhe’n onan owth a wra an tir bras 114 ow sychya, ha a-dhia y’n kres owth yw konsumys

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 fu l’uom che nacque e visse sanza pecca; 116 tu haï i piedi in su picciola spera 117 che l’altra faccia fa de la Giudecca.
query.error: **English:** 115 the man who was born and lived without sin; 116 you have your feet on the small sphere 117 that makes the other face of Giudecca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Qui è da man, quando di là è sera; 119 e questi, che ne fé scala col pelo, 120 fitto è ancora sì come prim’ era.
query.error: **English:** 118 Here it is morning, when it is evening there; 119 and this one, who made a ladder for us with his hair, 120 is still fixed as he was before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Da questa parte cadde giù dal cielo; 122 e la terra, che pria di qua si sporse, 123 per paura di lui fé del mar velo,
query.error: **English:** 121 From this side he fell down from heaven; 122 and the earth, which had previously jutted out here, 123 through fear of him made a veil of the sea,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 e venne a l’emisperio nostro; e forse 125 per fuggir lui lasciò qui loco vòto 126 quella ch’appar di qua, e sù ricorse».
query.error: **English:** 124 and came to our hemisphere; and perhaps 125 to flee from him she left an empty space here 126 that which appears here, and ran back up.
query.result: 124 ha dheuth dhe’n emysfer dhyn; ha marow 125 rag dhe dhiskwedhes ama, ha dhe renkas war-tu, 126 a wrug hedhi leel lowen a-dhia owth a wra gwag.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Luogo è là giù da Belzebù remoto 128 tanto quanto la tomba si distende, 129 che non per vista, ma per suono è noto
query.error: **English:** 127 There is a place down there, remote from Beelzebub, 128 as far as the tomb extends, 129 which is known not by sight, but by sound
query.result: 127 Le may leel a-dhia a-dhia Belzebù 128 kemmys ha’n tommen a wra estenys, 129 neb nyns yw aswonys dre weles, mes dre son

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 d’un ruscelletto che quivi discende 131 per la buca d’un sasso, ch’elli ha roso, 132 col corso ch’elli avvolge, e poco pende.
query.error: **English:** 130 of a small stream that descends there 131 through the hole of a rock, which it has gnawed, 132 with the course that it winds, and it slopes a little.
query.result: 130 a-dhia avon byghan owth a wra diskennas 131 dre dowr a-dhia karrek, owth ef a wra ros, 132 gans an fordh owth a wra ow kul, ha owth a wra kromm byghan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Lo duca e io per quel cammino ascoso 134 intrammo a ritornar nel chiaro mondo; 135 e sanza cura aver d’alcun riposo,
query.error: **English:** 133 The leader and I, by that hidden path, 134 entered to return to the bright world; 135 and without caring to have any rest,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 salimmo sù, el primo e io secondo, 137 tanto ch’i’ vidi de le cose belle 138 che porta ’l ciel, per un pertugio tondo.
query.error: **English:** 136 we climbed up, he first and I second, 137 so much that I saw of the beautiful things 138 that heaven bears, through a round opening.
query.result: 136 ni a-skynnas dhe-ves, my a-dhrys nessa, 137 bys dhe'n poynt yth welyas an gwella traow, 138 a-berth an nef a-dro dhe unn toll gronn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 E quindi uscimmo a riveder le stelle.
query.error: **English:** 139 And then we emerged to see the stars again.
query.result: 139 Ha wosa henna ni a-dhybrias dhe-ves dhe wul an steren.
